There is a specific logic in the system that manages secondary transactions when the corresponding primary transactions are not held within the same holding.

For example, if you execute a buy followed by a reallocation, the in-leg of the reallocation represents a secondary transaction whose associated primary is located in a different holding.

Customer specific issue and fix for it. There is a separate logic for the "Tax Lot Correction" transaction. The "Yield for Math. Adj."  is updated only if it is manually entered into the Tax lot Correction transaction. Otherwise, the current holding value is saved, despite the fact that the values that affect the calculation of the yield were adjusted. Now this logic has been supplemented with saving the "Date latest premium/discount dissolution"  from the holding, in order not to restart depreciation.

When new portfolios are added into FOH segment they cause warning about failed pre-calculation process. This is misleading for users as nothing is wrong with the pre-calculation.

Solution: Newly added portfolios should not cause message about pre-calculation not finished. Instead, we issue another warning about new portfolios appearance. The warning is needed as those new portfolios might potentially cause delays in processing incoming position changes because portfolios have higher priority and will be processed first.

The Performance Measurement execution could crash with an assertion error if using an index as a benchmark (defined directly in the performance measurement reporting tree) and if the index calendar is not aligned with the reporting calendar defined in the Performance Calculation. The situation for which the error could occur is a corner case where:

1. The reporting calendar defines a business date that is a holiday in the index calendar.
2. The preceding dates are holidays in the reporting calendar but business dates in the index calendar.
3. The index is empty on the last preceding reporting calendar holiday date.
4. The index has data on one or more of the remaining preceding reporting calendar holiday dates.

When calculating across these dates, the index returns on the reporting calendar holidays are expected to be moved to the next reporting calendar business date. But this did not happen and an assertion error was hit instead.

The error has been solved.

When doing a benchmark calculation for index security, reference rate or retail price based indices, there could be a problem with the fallback mechanism when searching for market data (price/yield/index value). The error could appear when such indices are used in a SAAM benchmark tree and if the underlying market data is missing on the first day of the SAAM tree. In this case the calculation will search back in time for the latest available market data using the number of fallback days that is defined on the related index calculation principle. But if the calculation period includes dates prior to the SAAM tree that contains the index, and if the index is not present in the previous SAAM tree, then the calculation would not search for market data in the previous period.

The fallback logic has been changed, so it searches for market data irrespective of whether or not the index is present in the previous SAAM period.

The form CTM and the form Find CTM Reference behave as "Main form" - "Subform". It means:
- When records on the main form are selected, the corresponding records must be loaded to the sub-form.
- When the main form is cleared,  the sub-form must be cleared as well.
- When the active record on the main form is inserted or deleted, the corresponding records must be reloaded to the sub-form.
- When the main form is closed, the sub-form must be closed as well.

#### What are the problems/motivations for the changes?

Several SimCorp Dimension installations can run the Alternatives Cloud Backend Service with identical configuration. As a consequence, there is no telling which installation the answering service is running in.

#### What is the proposed solution?

As a start, installation information is added to the service bus response meta data.

For the CDS Single Name instrument in the Trade Manager, a Pair clip may have a Pair valid to date. In the context of position based life cycle events like offset close, instrument data will be reloaded from the original position, however the Pair clip field will be emptied if the Effective date is larger or equal to the Pair valid to date.
